intro: Isodon loxothyrsus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. Isodon loxothyrsus is often found in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky soils, and it is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
